Description Do you want to solve business challenges through innovative technology? Do you enjoy working on cutting-edge, scalable services technology in a team environment? No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your project and learn in a real-world setting. Many of our technologies overlap, and you would be hard pressed to find a team that is not using Amazon Web Services (AWS), touching the catalogue, or iterating services to better personalise for customers. We make the impossible, possible. Title: Presales Solutions Architect
Description: At Iron Mountain we know that work, when done well, makes a positive impact for our customers, our employees, and our planet. That‚Äôs why we need smart, committed people to join us. Whether you‚Äôre looking to start your career or make a change, talk to us and see how you can elevate the power of your work at Iron Mountain. We provide expert, sustainable solutions in records and information management, digital transformation services, data centers, asset lifecycle management, and fine art storage, handling, and logistics. We proudly partner every day with our 225,000 customers around the world to preserve their invaluable artifacts, extract more from their inventory, and protect their data privacy in innovative and socially responsible ways. Are you curious about being part of our growth stor y while evolving your skills in a culture that will welcome your unique contributions? If so, let's start the conversation. As a Solutions Architect you will own all aspects of our clients‚Äô technical evaluation of our digital solutions,working in partnership with engineering, sales, and project services as a trusted technical and strategic advisor. It will be your job to impress upon our clients our product value proposition and differentiators with a well-developed mix of technical and business understanding, with the flexibility to pivot from business to technical discussions to share our product positioning and our client‚Äôs complex architectural landscape. Responsibilities: Partner with Sales Executives to achieve strategic and tactical goals for each client to advance deals to close Prepare for all client meetings with Sales Execs, Professional Services, our Partners, and other relevant players to ensure we are jointly presenting a coherent and concise path to success Deliver value-based demonstrations to our clients, focusing on technical solutions while still keying on their business challenges and initiatives Conduct in-depth discovery sessions for clients and partners with empathy to ensure we clearly Understand their pains and qualify our solutions and services to match their needs Become a subject matter expert in specific areas relevant to our business and able to provide advisory consulting services to other Solutions Architects and others in Iron Mountain ‚ÄòWalk the Halls‚Äô at strategic accounts to build customer relationships and grow our footprint there, in products and services Make presentations to all members of the clients‚Äô buying journey, including technical, business, and C-Suite participants Respond to RFPs, RFQ‚Äôs and build proposals for clients Proactively manage activities that take place during solution ideation, solution design, and solution implementation. Partner with members of Engineering to understand and influence the product backlog, sharing client feedback, and forming strategies and responses to client‚Äôs technical objections and challenges. Partner with Professional Services personnel to ensure we co-architect the best solution for clients, at the highest speed, ensuring customer satisfaction Able to present our products and services at events like conferences, trade shows, webinars, or other marketing events. Work closely with our strategic advisors to identify market trends and areas of opportunity for our digital products Create Scope and Solution architecture design documents to be shared internally as well as our clients Responsible for pricing of deals and subsequent authoring of the SOWs. Support complex pricing models and solution designs. Responsible for solution design reviews and getting the solution approved for deal reviews. Work with other stakeholders - professional services, revenue management, finance, operations, etc on a deal and get inputs to finalize the pricing model. Qualifications: Bachelors or Masters degree in a related field At least 5 years experience in Pre-Sales consulting or Professional Consulting services with a passion for both winning the technical aspects of deals and for long-term customer success Understanding of basic ECM, BPM, App-Dev, and AI/ML concepts with the ability to articulate all to non-technical clients in a way that showcases value Understanding of deployment architecture and be able to effectively articulate the differences and benefits - cloud, on-prem Effective written and verbal communication skills, building presentations and design sessions, and facilitating customer discussions Basic understanding of major cloud Infrastructure providers and functional services such as AWS and GCP Familiarity with Low-Code platforms, IDP, and software development tools like Java and Python are a plus Ability to leverage deep technical, documentation, and relationships to respond to technical, functional, and non-functional requirements in RFPs Proven success guiding customers through the entire lifecycle of a complex software deal Demonstrated background partnering with product management, engineering, and project services teams A proven track record building custom demos and POCs both independently and leading a team A tendency to think outside the box when it comes to solution design Hunger to learn new disciplines, concepts, and technologies, with the ability to capture actionable feedback and make meaningful adjustments to ensure success Discover What We Offer Discover Limitless Possibilities: Embark on an exciting journey with Iron Mountain, a global organization that embraces transformation and innovation. Empowering Inclusion: Join a supportive environment where everyone's voice is heard, opinions are valued, and feedback is encouraged, fostering an atmosphere of inclusion and belonging. Global Connectivity: Connect with 26,000+ talented individuals from 59 countries, opening doors to diverse cultures and fostering global learning opportunities. Championing Individuality: Be part of a winning team that celebrates diversity and encourages individual differences to drive greatness.. Competitive Total Rewards: supporting your career at Iron Mountain, family, personal wellness, and wellbeing. (Local benefits may vary based on country-specific policies.) Embrace Flexibility: Experience the freedom of remote/hybrid work, enabling a harmonious work-life balance (dependent on role). Unleash Your Potential: Access abundant opportunities for personal and professional growth, preparing you for a digitalized future. Valuing Every Contribution: Join a workplace that actively encourages and supports all talents, recognizing the unique impact of each individual. Pioneering Sustainability: Contribute to our vision of fostering a sustainable and thriving workforce, leaving an enduring legacy for generations to come. Show more Show less

Title: Senior Front-End JS Engineer

Every project phase is well-planned, starting with an in-depth discovery process, which ensures clarity and productivity. Inclusive Culture Join a diverse, multicultural team where every opinion is valued. Collaborate across disciplines to deliver exceptional solutions. Is this you? A strong frontend engineer with experience in React and building design systems. A proponent of user-centric development with an eye for design and user experience. Someone who is able to put themselves in the user‚Äôs shoes and contribute to discussions around product development. In other words, your coding abilities are complemented by a solid understanding of business models, business goals, user journeys, value propositions, and the ability to discuss product features in detail. Experience building design systems - creating reusable components used by other developers. Proficient with modern testing frameworks (e.g. Cypress). Strong debugging and testing skills. Strong communication skills in English. Experience in backend development with Node.js (Express or Nestjs) would be a great bonus. Experience in designing UX/UI journeys would be a great bonus. Our Tech Stack ReactJS and React Native. NextJs. Bootstrap. NestJS. MongoDB, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch. AWS. Figma. Storybook. Lerna / Bit.dev. Strapi Headless CMS. Title: Database Administrator
Description: Description De L'offre D'emploi Joining Cnexia is choosing to be part of an ambitious project that values Innovation, promotes Continuous Learning and enables all tech champions to fulfill their creative dreams. At Cnexia, we do more than support the clients of our world-class network and services. We develop innovative solutions and create original multiplatform media content. In fact, we‚Äôre revolutionizing how Canadians communicate on the web, interact with Mobile Apps or benefit from an AI-enhanced experience. Proud of our status as a fully owned Moroccan subsidiary of the largest Canadian Telecom company, we have been ceaselessly growing our team since 2021. With over 1100 employees, mainly based in Fez, we have expanded in the northern region of the kingdom with our Brand-new state of the art site in Technopolis Rabat. If you are ready for this challenge, we invite you to join a community that values bold ideas and professional growth all in an engaging multi-cultural world-class environment. As a Database Administrator, your main responsibilities will be as follows: Conduct weekly performance analysis using AWR reports. Review and optimize SQL queries after every release. Refine execution plans for critical queries. Continuously monitor storage and data files. Perform monthly (Prod) and daily (QA) validation of backup and recovery procedures. Audit user privileges and access controls as needed. Configure database alerts and notifications. Periodically archive historical data and maintain archive scripts. Conduct SQL code reviews for merge requests in GitHub. Regularly monitor database resource utilization and request optimization as needed. Provide daily support to developers and assist with database-level issues. Create PL/SQL procedures and execute data migration tasks between Maximo databases. Export and import dump files to refresh Dev, Preprod, and Training environments. Comp√©tences et exp√©rience requises Profile Main Requirements (must Have Qualifications) University or college degree in engineering, computer sciences, physic, mathematics or relevant experience in equivalent domain Great communication skills in English and French 5+ years experience maintaining a Oracle DB 3+ years experience conducting weekly performance analysis by reviewing AWR reports to identify and address performance bottlenecks efficiently. 5+ years of experience as an Oracle Database Administrator. Strong understanding of Oracle database architecture, performance tuning, and optimization. Experience with SQL query optimization, index management, and storage management. Experience with Oracle backup and recovery procedures. Experience with Oracle security auditing and compliance. Experience with data archiving and migration. Experience with Oracle alert configuration and monitoring. Experience with SQL code review and approval. Continuously monitor storage and data files to identify potential space issues and implement necessary maintenance, such as resizing data files or tablespaces. Perform monthly validation of the backup and recovery procedures to ensure that the data is protected and can be restored in case of a failure or data loss. Periodically, archive historical data to reduce the size of the database, improving overall system performance and reducing storage costs. 3+ years experience configuring database alerts and notifications to proactively identify and address potential issues, such as high resource usage, before they impact application performance. Upon receiving an alert or notification, take appropriate action to resolve the issue promptly. 3+ years experience creating PL/SQL procedures and execute data migration tasks between Maximo databases as requested, either for developer (DEV) or project owner (PO). Regularly monitor database resource utilization, such as CPU, memory, and storage, and request resource optimization as needed to support application growth. Nice To Have Ability to work effectively in a team environment. Has work experience in DEVOPS and Agile environment Show more Show less

Description Do you want to solve business challenges through innovative technology? Do you enjoy working on cutting-edge, scalable services technology in a team environment? Do you like working on industry-defining projects that move the needle? At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build on behalf of our customers. The intense focus we have on our customers is why we are one of the world‚Äôs most beloved brands ‚Äì customer obsession is part of our company DNA. Our interns write real software and collaborate with a selected group of experienced software development engineers who help interns on projects that matter to our customers. We want to you to feel welcomed, included and valued right from the start. Every day will be filled with exciting new challenges, developing new skills, and achieving personal growth. How often can you say that your work changes the world? At Amazon, you‚Äôll say it often. Join us and define tomorrow. We Have Two Different Internship Durations Available 3 months internship 6 months internship Please ensure to indicate your availability during the application process. Key job responsibilities Collaborate with experienced cross-disciplinary Amazonians to conceive, design, and bring to market innovative products and services. Design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment and help lead fundamental changes in the industry. Create solutions to run predictions on distributed systems with exposure to innovative technologies at incredible scale and speed. Build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault-tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage/use. Work in an agile environment to deliver high quality software. A day in the life As an intern, you will be matched to a manager and a mentor. You will have the opportunity to influence the evolution of Amazon technology and lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your design, code, and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mining, automation, optimisation, scalability, and security ‚Äì just to name a few. In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in activities with other interns throughout your internship. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your project and learn in a real-world setting. Many of our technologies overlap, and you would be hard pressed to find a team that is not using Amazon Web Services (AWS), touching the catalogue, or iterating services to better personalise for customers. We make the impossible, possible. Basic Qualifications Currently enrolled in a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields at time of application Although no specific programming language is required ‚Äì you should be familiar with the syntax of languages such as Java, C/C++, or Python Knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals such as object-oriented design, algorithm design, data structures, problem solving and complexity analysis Preferred Qualifications Previous technical internship(s) if applicable Experience with distributed, multi-tiered systems, algorithms, and relational databases Experience in optimization mathematics such as linear programming and nonlinear optimisation Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions Adept at handling ambiguous or undefined problems as well as ability to think abstractly Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. Title: Presales Solutions Architect
Description: At Iron Mountain we know that work, when done well, makes a positive impact for our customers, our employees, and our planet. That‚Äôs why we need smart, committed people to join us. Whether you‚Äôre looking to start your career or make a change, talk to us and see how you can elevate the power of your work at Iron Mountain. We provide expert, sustainable solutions in records and information management, digital transformation services, data centers, asset lifecycle management, and fine art storage, handling, and logistics. We proudly partner every day with our 225,000 customers around the world to preserve their invaluable artifacts, extract more from their inventory, and protect their data privacy in innovative and socially responsible ways. Are you curious about being part of our growth stor y while evolving your skills in a culture that will welcome your unique contributions? If so, let's start the conversation. As a Solutions Architect you will own all aspects of our clients‚Äô technical evaluation of our digital solutions,working in partnership with engineering, sales, and project services as a trusted technical and strategic advisor. It will be your job to impress upon our clients our product value proposition and differentiators with a well-developed mix of technical and business understanding, with the flexibility to pivot from business to technical discussions to share our product positioning and our client‚Äôs complex architectural landscape. Responsibilities: Partner with Sales Executives to achieve strategic and tactical goals for each client to advance deals to close Prepare for all client meetings with Sales Execs, Professional Services, our Partners, and other relevant players to ensure we are jointly presenting a coherent and concise path to success Deliver value-based demonstrations to our clients, focusing on technical solutions while still keying on their business challenges and initiatives Conduct in-depth discovery sessions for clients and partners with empathy to ensure we clearly Understand their pains and qualify our solutions and services to match their needs Become a subject matter expert in specific areas relevant to our business and able to provide advisory consulting services to other Solutions Architects and others in Iron Mountain ‚ÄòWalk the Halls‚Äô at strategic accounts to build customer relationships and grow our footprint there, in products and services Make presentations to all members of the clients‚Äô buying journey, including technical, business, and C-Suite participants Respond to RFPs, RFQ‚Äôs and build proposals for clients Proactively manage activities that take place during solution ideation, solution design, and solution implementation. Partner with members of Engineering to understand and influence the product backlog, sharing client feedback, and forming strategies and responses to client‚Äôs technical objections and challenges. Partner with Professional Services personnel to ensure we co-architect the best solution for clients, at the highest speed, ensuring customer satisfaction Able to present our products and services at events like conferences, trade shows, webinars, or other marketing events. Work closely with our strategic advisors to identify market trends and areas of opportunity for our digital products Create Scope and Solution architecture design documents to be shared internally as well as our clients Responsible for pricing of deals and subsequent authoring of the SOWs. Support complex pricing models and solution designs. Responsible for solution design reviews and getting the solution approved for deal reviews. Work with other stakeholders - professional services, revenue management, finance, operations, etc on a deal and get inputs to finalize the pricing model. Qualifications: Bachelors or Masters degree in a related field At least 5 years experience in Pre-Sales consulting or Professional Consulting services with a passion for both winning the technical aspects of deals and for long-term customer success Understanding of basic ECM, BPM, App-Dev, and AI/ML concepts with the ability to articulate all to non-technical clients in a way that showcases value Understanding of deployment architecture and be able to effectively articulate the differences and benefits - cloud, on-prem Effective written and verbal communication skills, building presentations and design sessions, and facilitating customer discussions Basic understanding of major cloud Infrastructure providers and functional services such as AWS and GCP Familiarity with Low-Code platforms, IDP, and software development tools like Java and Python are a plus Ability to leverage deep technical, documentation, and relationships to respond to technical, functional, and non-functional requirements in RFPs Proven success guiding customers through the entire lifecycle of a complex software deal Demonstrated background partnering with product management, engineering, and project services teams A proven track record building custom demos and POCs both independently and leading a team A tendency to think outside the box when it comes to solution design Hunger to learn new disciplines, concepts, and technologies, with the ability to capture actionable feedback and make meaningful adjustments to ensure success Discover What We Offer Discover Limitless Possibilities: Embark on an exciting journey with Iron Mountain, a global organization that embraces transformation and innovation. Empowering Inclusion: Join a supportive environment where everyone's voice is heard, opinions are valued, and feedback is encouraged, fostering an atmosphere of inclusion and belonging. Global Connectivity: Connect with 26,000+ talented individuals from 59 countries, opening doors to diverse cultures and fostering global learning opportunities. Championing Individuality: Be part of a winning team that celebrates diversity and encourages individual differences to drive greatness.. Competitive Total Rewards: supporting your career at Iron Mountain, family, personal wellness, and wellbeing. (Local benefits may vary based on country-specific policies.) Embrace Flexibility: Experience the freedom of remote/hybrid work, enabling a harmonious work-life balance (dependent on role). Unleash Your Potential: Access abundant opportunities for personal and professional growth, preparing you for a digitalized future. Valuing Every Contribution: Join a workplace that actively encourages and supports all talents, recognizing the unique impact of each individual. Pioneering Sustainability: Contribute to our vision of fostering a sustainable and thriving workforce, leaving an enduring legacy for generations to come. Show more Show less

Title: Senior Front-End JS Engineer
Description: This position is 100% remote. Who are we looking for? Purpose-Driven: You understand how your work impacts end-users and business goals. You‚Äôre result-oriented and always curious to learn more. Experienced Remote Worker: You value work-life balance, are disciplined in managing your time, and are comfortable working within a structured remote environment. Why CobbleWeb? Work-Life Balance Enjoy the flexibility of remote work without the stress of commutes and unnecessary meetings. We offer fixed working hours (+- 40 hours per week) divided into core and flexible daily time-slots to suit your schedule. Professional Growth Growth at CobbleWeb is non-negotiable. Work on diverse and challenging ecommerce projects that will push your skills to new heights. Be part of a rapidly-growing team that values your input and encourages continuous learning. Purpose-Driven Process Our structured approach to product development is rooted in Agile principles and Lean methodology. Every project phase is well-planned, starting with an in-depth discovery process, which ensures clarity and productivity. Inclusive Culture Join a diverse, multicultural team where every opinion is valued. Collaborate across disciplines to deliver exceptional solutions. Is this you? A strong frontend engineer with experience in React and building design systems. A proponent of user-centric development with an eye for design and user experience. Someone who is able to put themselves in the user‚Äôs shoes and contribute to discussions around product development. In other words, your coding abilities are complemented by a solid understanding of business models, business goals, user journeys, value propositions, and the ability to discuss product features in detail. Someone with outstanding communication skills. A software engineer with solid debugging and testing skills. Strong work ethic and pride in the quality of your code. Enjoy working closely with others in a cross-functional team. Why should you apply? An independent and profitable business that is doubling in size. More than 12 years experience in designing, building, and optimizing high-growth online marketplaces. Technically complex projects that often present unique business challenges that need solving. A distributed company, headquartered in London, UK, with a strong documentation and iteration culture that supports remote team members based in Europe, Africa, the Middle East, and the Caucasus region. We take full ownership of marketplace projects in close collaboration with our clients. We‚Äôre a close-knit in-house team who love working together. We don‚Äôt outsource core functions. If you are looking for a fast-growing company that ticks all these boxes and more, working at CobbleWeb may be the opportunity you‚Äôve been looking for. Job Requirements Strong fundamentals in JavaScript, TypeScript, React, HTML, and CSS. Expert-level knowledge of and proven experience working with JS libraries such as React, Redux for state management, React Query, etc. Expert-level knowledge of and proven experience working with component-based architecture (React components, Storybook, Design system, Lerna, NPM/Yarn). Experience building design systems - creating reusable components used by other developers. Proficient with modern testing frameworks (e.g. Cypress). Strong debugging and testing skills. Strong communication skills in English. Experience in backend development with Node.js (Express or Nestjs) would be a great bonus. Experience in designing UX/UI journeys would be a great bonus. Our Tech Stack ReactJS and React Native. NextJs. Bootstrap. NestJS. MongoDB, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch. AWS. Figma. Storybook. Lerna / Bit.dev. Strapi Headless CMS. Title: Database Administrator
Description: Description De L'offre D'emploi Joining Cnexia is choosing to be part of an ambitious project that values Innovation, promotes Continuous Learning and enables all tech champions to fulfill their creative dreams. At Cnexia, we do more than support the clients of our world-class network and services. We develop innovative solutions and create original multiplatform media content. In fact, we‚Äôre revolutionizing how Canadians communicate on the web, interact with Mobile Apps or benefit from an AI-enhanced experience. Proud of our status as a fully owned Moroccan subsidiary of the largest Canadian Telecom company, we have been ceaselessly growing our team since 2021. With over 1100 employees, mainly based in Fez, we have expanded in the northern region of the kingdom with our Brand-new state of the art site in Technopolis Rabat. If you are ready for this challenge, we invite you to join a community that values bold ideas and professional growth all in an engaging multi-cultural world-class environment. As a Database Administrator, your main responsibilities will be as follows: Conduct weekly performance analysis using AWR reports. Review and optimize SQL queries after every release. Refine execution plans for critical queries. Continuously monitor storage and data files. Perform monthly (Prod) and daily (QA) validation of backup and recovery procedures. Audit user privileges and access controls as needed. Configure database alerts and notifications. Periodically archive historical data and maintain archive scripts. Conduct SQL code reviews for merge requests in GitHub. Regularly monitor database resource utilization and request optimization as needed. Provide daily support to developers and assist with database-level issues. Create PL/SQL procedures and execute data migration tasks between Maximo databases. Export and import dump files to refresh Dev, Preprod, and Training environments. Comp√©tences et exp√©rience requises Profile Main Requirements (must Have Qualifications) University or college degree in engineering, computer sciences, physic, mathematics or relevant experience in equivalent domain Great communication skills in English and French 5+ years experience maintaining a Oracle DB 3+ years experience conducting weekly performance analysis by reviewing AWR reports to identify and address performance bottlenecks efficiently. 5+ years of experience as an Oracle Database Administrator. Strong understanding of Oracle database architecture, performance tuning, and optimization. Experience with SQL query optimization, index management, and storage management. Experience with Oracle backup and recovery procedures. Experience with Oracle security auditing and compliance. Experience with data archiving and migration. Experience with Oracle alert configuration and monitoring. Experience with SQL code review and approval. Continuously monitor storage and data files to identify potential space issues and implement necessary maintenance, such as resizing data files or tablespaces. Perform monthly validation of the backup and recovery procedures to ensure that the data is protected and can be restored in case of a failure or data loss. Periodically, archive historical data to reduce the size of the database, improving overall system performance and reducing storage costs. 3+ years experience configuring database alerts and notifications to proactively identify and address potential issues, such as high resource usage, before they impact application performance. Upon receiving an alert or notification, take appropriate action to resolve the issue promptly. 3+ years experience creating PL/SQL procedures and execute data migration tasks between Maximo databases as requested, either for developer (DEV) or project owner (PO). Regularly monitor database resource utilization, such as CPU, memory, and storage, and request resource optimization as needed to support application growth. Nice To Have Ability to work effectively in a team environment. Has work experience in DEVOPS and Agile environment Show more Show less
